title: The Nasty Bits: Pork Skin Soup
summary: The Nasty Bits: Pork Skin Soup is a gluten free, dairy free, and whole 30 recipe with 4 servings. For $1.36 per serving, this recipe covers 2% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 41 calories, 1g of protein, and 0g of fat. 1 person were impressed by this recipe. It will be a hit at your Autumn event. It works well as a soup. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 45 minutes. A mixture of vegetable broth, leafy vegetable, pig skin, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so flavorful. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 11%. This score is not so amazing. Try The Nasty Bits: Pork Neck Posole, The Nasty Bits: Frog Soup, and The Nasty Bits: Rabbit and Garlic Soup for similar recipes.
instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            Soak the sheet of dried pig skin in water to cover, for at least 8 hours and up to a few days in the refrigerator.  When you are ready to make the soup, cut the skin into 1-inch chunks and set aside.                                                                                                                             2                                                                            Wash and cut your napa cabbage, or another vegetable of your choice.  Set aside.                                                                                                                             3                                                                            Bring the broth to a boil and add the chopped pork skin and vegetables.  Simmer for 20 minutes, until both the cabbage and the skin have fully softened.  If you are using a vegetable that takes less time to cook, such as bok choy, add the cut-up vegetables towards the last few minutes of cooking.

steps.step: Soak the sheet of dried pig skin in water to cover, for at least 8 hours and up to a few days in the refrigerator.  When you are ready to make the soup, cut the skin into 1-inch chunks and set aside.
Wash and cut your napa cabbage, or another vegetable of your choice.  Set aside.

Bring the broth to a boil and add the chopped pork skin and vegetables.  Simmer for 20 minutes, until both the cabbage and the skin have fully softened.  If you are using a vegetable that takes less time to cook, such as bok choy, add the cut-up vegetables towards the last few minutes of cooking.
